author: pbritt
title: Experts Provide Mobile Retail Outlook
text:
Posted by pbritt on Sep 2nd, 2015 in Featured Stories , Mobile Payments Conference | 0 comments 
Most merchants haven’t positioned themselves for the realities of mobile marketing and mobile payments, a panel told the audience at the Mobile Payments Conference in Chicago today. 
While some companies will be satisfied with online and mobile sales, other companies will want mobile advertising to drive consumers into stores for better cross-sale opportunities, said Kevin Buerger, executive vice president and managing director, U.S. Agency for Jellyfish 
“We’re on the cusp of retailers being able to work with customers through multiple platforms, using different touchpoints,” said Said Allan Haims, president and CEO of StepsAway “The customers will pull trigger on the offers that they find to be relevant.” 
Philbin also discussed the rising influence of mobile technology. 
The merchants that will be the losers in the evolving digital economy will be the ones that don’t embrace the available technology, Haims added. 
Jack Philbin, CEO of Vibes, predicted that mobile is on the cusp of a wallet revolution. Most consumers don’t want to carry several mobile wallets on their phone, just like they don’t want to carry several credit cards in a physical wallet. So consumers will opt for a few of their favorites. As a result, the multi-merchant wallets, such as Google Wallet and Apple Pay, will be the winners, while consumers move away from single-merchant payment vehicles. 
Philbin added that merchants need to focus more resources on mobile marketing and less on online marketing. 
“The desktop is going away,” Philbin said. “Search queries have grown from 50 percent from mobile to 70 percent from mobile.” Share this:
